required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate the Safety, Efficacy and Pharmacokinetics of Teduglutide in Japanese Subjects With PN-dependent Short Bowel Syndrome (SBS)
clinical_study.official_title: A 4-Stage, Open-label, Multicenter Study Including Long-term Extension to Evaluate the Safety, Efficacy and Pharmacokinetics of Teduglutide in Japanese Subjects With PN-dependent Short Bowel Syndrome

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of an investigational treatment (teduglutide) in Japanese patients with PN-dependent SBS. This study will also look at how teduglutide moves through the body (pharmacokinetics).

primary_outcome.measure: Stage 2: Absolute Change From Baseline in Weekly Parenteral Support (PS) Volume at Week 24
primary_outcome.description: Absolute change from baseline in weekly PS volume at Week 24 was reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Stage 2: Percent Change From Baseline in Weekly Parenteral Support (PS) Volume at Week 24
primary_outcome.description: Percent change from baseline in weekly PS volume at Week 24 was reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Stage 2: Percentage of Participants Who Demonstrate Response to Teduglutide at End of Stage 2
primary_outcome.description: Response was defined as the achievement of at least a 20% reduction from baseline (Visit 2) in weekly PS volume at Week 20 and again at Week 24.

primary_outcome.measure: Stage 2: Absolute Change From Baseline in Number of Days Per Week of Parenteral Support (PS) Usage at Week 24
primary_outcome.description: Absolute change from baseline in number of days per Week of PS usage at Week 24 was reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Stage 2: Absolute Change From Baseline in Plasma Citrulline Levels at Week 24
primary_outcome.description: Plasma citrulline was measured as an assessment of enterocyte mass. Absolute change from baseline in plasma citrulline levels at Week 24 was reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Stage 2: Percent Change From Baseline in Plasma Citrulline Levels at Week 24
primary_outcome.description: Plasma citrulline was measured as an assessment of enterocyte mass. Percent change from baseline in plasma citrulline at Week 24 was reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Stage 2: Number of Participants Who Achieved Enteral Autonomy at Week 24
primary_outcome.description: Enteral autonomy was defined as no prescribed PS and no use of PS recorded in the participant diary at the end of stage 2. Number of participants who achieved enteral autonomy at Week 24 was reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Stage 3: Absolute Change From Baseline in Weekly Parenteral Support (PS) Volume at Extension Month 24
primary_outcome.description: Absolute change from baseline in weekly PS volume at extension Month 24 was reported. Extension month 24 = 30 months of teduglutide treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Stage 3: Percent Change From Baseline in Weekly Parenteral Support (PS) Volume at Extension Month 24
primary_outcome.description: Percent change from baseline in weekly PS volume at extension Month 24 was reported. Extension month 24 = 30 months of teduglutide treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Stage 3: Absolute Change From Baseline in Number of Days Per Week of Parenteral Support (PS) Usage at Extension Month 24
primary_outcome.description: Absolute change from baseline in number of days per Week of PS usage at extension Month 24 was reported. Extension month 24 = 30 months of teduglutide treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Stage 3: Absolute Change From Baseline in Plasma Citrulline Levels at Extension Month 24
primary_outcome.description: Plasma citrulline was measured as an assessment of enterocyte mass. Absolute change from baseline in plasma citrulline levels at extension Month 24 was reported. Extension month 24 = 30 months of teduglutide treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Stage 3: Percent Change From Baseline in Plasma Citrulline Levels at Extension Month 24
primary_outcome.description: Plasma citrulline was measured as an assessment of enterocyte mass. Percent change from baseline in plasma citrulline at extension Month 24 was reported. Extension month 24 = 30 months of teduglutide treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Stage 4: Absolute Change From Baseline in Weekly Parenteral Support (PS) Volume at End of Treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (stage 4), End of Treatment (up to 47 months)
primary_outcome.description: Absolute change from baseline in weekly PS volume at end of treatment was reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Stage 4: Percent Change From Baseline in Weekly Parenteral Support (PS) Volume at End of Treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (stage 4), End of Treatment (up to 47 months)
primary_outcome.description: Percent change from baseline in weekly PS volume at end of treatment was reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Stage 4: Absolute Change From Baseline in Number of Days Per Week of Parenteral Support (PS) Usage at End of Treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (stage 4), End of Treatment (up to 47 months)
primary_outcome.description: Absolute change from baseline in number of days per week of PS usage at end of treatment was reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Stage 4: Absolute Change From Baseline in Plasma Citrulline Levels at End of Treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (stage 4), End of Treatment (up to 47 months)
primary_outcome.description: Plasma citrulline was measured as an assessment of enterocyte mass. Absolute change from baseline in plasma citrulline levels at end of treatment was reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Stage 4: Percent Change From Baseline in Plasma Citrulline Levels at End of Treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (stage 4), End of Treatment (up to 47 months)
primary_outcome.description: Plasma citrulline was measured as an assessment of enterocyte mass. Percent change in plasma citrulline from baseline at end of treatment was reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Concentration-Time Curve From Time Zero to Infinity (AUC0-Inf) of Teduglutide in Plasma
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the concentration-time curve from time zero to infinity of teduglutide in plasma were evaluated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Concentration-Time Curve From Time Zero to the Last Time Point (AUC0-t) of Teduglutide in Plasma
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the concentration-time curve from time zero to the last time point of teduglutide in plasma were evaluated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Concentration (Cmax) of Teduglutide in Plasma
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum concentration of teduglutide in plasma were evaluated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Maximum Observed Drug Concentration (Tmax) of Teduglutide in Plasma
secondary_outcome.description: Time to reach maximum observed drug concentration of teduglutide in plasma was evaluated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Terminal Half-Life (t1/2) of Teduglutide in Plasma
secondary_outcome.description: Terminal half-life of teduglutide in plasma were evaluated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Apparent Clearance (CL/F) of Teduglutide in Plasma
secondary_outcome.description: Apparent clearance of teduglutide in plasma were evaluated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Apparent Volume of Distribution (Vz/F) of Teduglutide in Plasma
secondary_outcome.description: Apparent volume of distribution of teduglutide in plasma were evaluated.

arm_group.description: 0.05 mg/kg/day administered by subcutaneous injection over a 24-week period.

intervention.description: 0.05 mg/kg/day administered by subcutaneous injection over a 24-week period.

criteria.textblock:
This study has 3 stages, consisting of an optimization/stabilization period (Stage 1), a 24-week treatment period in which all patients will receive teduglutide (Stage 2), and a long-term extension (Stage 3).
During the long-term extension (Stage 3), patients will continue to receive teduglutide for up to an additional 24 months or until teduglutide is commercially available, whichever comes earlier.

facility.name: Hospital of Hyogo College of Medicine
Osaka University Hospital, Department of Gastroenterological Surgery
Osaka University Hospital, Department of Pediatric Surgery

patient_data.ipd_description: De-identified individual participant data from this particular study will not be shared as there is a reasonable likelihood that individual patients could be re-identified (due to the limited number of study participants/study sites, …)

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study was conducted at five centers in Japan between 18 December 2014 (first participant first visit) and 12 November 2018 (last participant last visit).
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Screened participants underwent a maximum 8 week parenteral support (PS) optimization period and 4 to 8 week stabilization period (stage 1) followed by 24 weeks treatment period (stage 2), and a long-term extension period were all participants received same treatment of stage 2 in stage 3 and stage 4. Total study duration was up to 47 months.

group.title: Teduglutide
group.description: Optimized and stabilized participants received subcutaneous (SC) injection of teduglutide at a dose of 0.05 milligram per kilogram per day (mg/kg/day) once daily for 24 weeks during stage 2, an additional 24 months in stage 3 and continued (stage 4) until the participants entered the long-term extension study SHP633-307 (NCT03596164) or discontinued.

baseline.population: Safety population consisted of all participants in the intent-to-treat (ITT) population who received at least one dose of study drug. ITT population consists of all participants who are enrolled and eligible to enter Stage 2.

group.title: Teduglutide
group.description: Optimized and stabilized participants received subcutaneous (SC) injection of teduglutide at a dose of 0.05 milligram per kilogram per day (mg/kg/day) once daily for 24 weeks during stage 2, an additional 24 months in stage 3 and continued (stage 4) until the participants entered the long-term extension study SHP633-307 (NCT03596164) or discontinued.

outcome.title: Area Under the Concentration-Time Curve From Time Zero to Infinity (AUC0-Inf) of Teduglutide in Plasma
outcome.description: Area under the concentration-time curve from time zero to infinity of teduglutide in plasma were evaluated.
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic (PK) analysis population was defined as all participants, at Stage 2, in the safety analysis population for whom the primary PK data were considered sufficient and interpretable.

measure.title: Area Under the Concentration-Time Curve From Time Zero to the Last Time Point (AUC0-t) of Teduglutide in Plasma
measure.description: Area under the concentration-time curve from time zero to the last time point of teduglutide in plasma were evaluated.
measure.population: PK analysis population was defined as all participants, at Stage 2, in the safety analysis population for whom the primary PK data were considered sufficient and interpretable.

outcome.title: Maximum Concentration (Cmax) of Teduglutide in Plasma
outcome.description: Maximum concentration of teduglutide in plasma were evaluated.
outcome.population: PK analysis population was defined as all participants, at Stage 2, in the safety analysis population for whom the primary PK data were considered sufficient and interpretable.

group.title: Teduglutide
group.description: Optimized and stabilized participants received subcutaneous (SC) injection of teduglutide at a dose of 0.05 milligram per kilogram per day (mg/kg/day) once daily for 24 weeks during stage 2, an additional 24 months in stage 3 and continued (stage 4) until the participants entered the long-term extension study SHP633-307 (NCT03596164) or discontinued.

measure.title: Maximum Concentration (Cmax) of Teduglutide in Plasma
measure.description: Maximum concentration of teduglutide in plasma were evaluated.
measure.population: PK analysis population was defined as all participants, at Stage 2, in the safety analysis population for whom the primary PK data were considered sufficient and interpretable.

outcome.description: Time to reach maximum observed drug concentration of teduglutide in plasma was evaluated.

reported_events.time_frame: From start of study treatment up to end of the study (up to 47 months)

group.title: Teduglutide
group.description: Optimized and stabilized participants received subcutaneous (SC) injection of teduglutide at a dose of 0.05 milligram per kilogram per day (mg/kg/day) once daily for 24 weeks during stage 2, an additional 24 months in stage 3 and continued (stage 4) until the participants entered the long-term extension study SHP633-307 (NCT03596164) or discontinued.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: If a multicenter publication is not submitted within twelve (12) months after conclusion, abandonment or termination of the Study at all sites, or after Sponsor confirms there shall be no multicenter Study publication, the Institution and/or such Principal Investigator may publish the results from the Institution site individually.
